title: The story of 7-year-old Rola Al Mayali, who drowned while her family was trying to cross to England
summary: The makeshift boat carrying the little girl and her Iraqi family, along with some 15 other migrants, capsized on March 3, in the Aa canal in northern France, 30 kilometers from the coast. Around 100 people attended her funeral in northern France.

title: AI action plan outlines how to place France 'at the cutting edge'
summary: This technology represents a potential source of growth and jobs, according to the report submitted to Emmanuel Macron on March 13. Focusing on investment, sovereignty and training, some of the recommendations could prove controversial.

title: European Parliament adopts 'historic' AI Act
summary: The far-reaching regulation aims to both protect citizens from the possible risks of a quickly-developping technology and foster innovation on the continent.

title: Blinken confirms Kenya's plan to send security mission to Haiti
summary: The US secretary of state announced that Kenyan President Ruto will send a security mission once a transitional council has been established.

title: Champions League: Atlético beat Inter to reach quarter-finals
summary: Madrid won with a thrilling 3-2 penalty shoot-out on Wednesday.

title: Musk cancels 'The Don Lemon Show' on X after he sits for the program's first interview
summary: In a video posted on X, Lemon declared that 'Elon Musk is mad at me,' and said he will be airing the interview on YouTube and via podcast on Monday.

title: Le Monde and Open AI sign partnership agreement on artificial intelligence
summary: This multi-year agreement, the first between a French media organization and a major AI player, will enable OpenAI to draw on our newspaper's corpus to establish and enhance the reliability of the answers of its ChatGPT tool, in return for a significant source of additional revenue.

title: In Algeria, filmmakers who offend 'national values' and religion threatened with jail
summary: The parliament has passed a law curbing creativity, at odds with the government's stated ambition to make the country an international production and shooting hub.

title: Attack on Navalny ally Volkov 'likely' organized 'by Russia,' says Lithuania
summary: Russian opposition figure Leonid Volkov was attacked with a hammer in Lithuania on Tuesday evening.

title: Renewed gold mining interest in France's Limousin region raises concerns
summary: Four exclusive exploration permits have been issued in just a few years in the Haute-Vienne and Dordogne departments, where the last gold mines closed 20 years ago.

title: US House of Representatives overwhelmingly passes TikTok ban bill
summary: Passed by a vote of 352-65, the bill now goes to the Senate, where its prospects are unclear.

title: 'There's Still Tomorrow' director, Paola Cortellesi: 'A minority of men still won't take no for an answer'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the actress and director examined the massive success of her first film in Italy.

title: French PM accuses far right of being 'pro-Putin' during debate on Ukraine strategy
summary: The Assemblée Nationale on Tuesday voted in favor of the Paris-Kyiv security agreement, despite opposition on the left, abstention from the far right, and criticisms of Macron's comments on possibly sending troops to Ukraine.

title: Concorde to return to New York's Intrepid Museum after seven-month restoration
summary: The Concorde is the only supersonic commercial jet that ever flew. Public tours of the jet will resume on April 4.

title: The European Parliament will take legal action over EU funds released for Hungary
summary: For the first time, the judges in Luxembourg must examine a case concerning the connection between the payment of EU funds and respect for the rule of law.

title: Covid-19 has shortened human life expectancy by one and a half years, according to new study
summary: A vast compilation of statistics, published in 'The Lancet,' estimates the additional mortality attributable to the pandemic between 2019 and 2021 at 15.9 million individuals.

title: Dutch far-right leader Wilders announces he will not be prime minister
summary: After a convincing victory in the November election, Wilders said his position was impossible as a result of a lack of support across the political spectrum.

title: Haitian PM's resignation paves way for uncertain transition
summary: Ariel Henry, who had been acting president of Haiti since the 2021 assassination of Jovenel Moïse, was pushed out of office by leaders of Caribbean states.

title: An amphibian that feeds its young with milk
summary: The female of this species, which looks like a large snake, lays eggs. But she excretes a kind of milk from her cloaca, which her babies love, but they also feast on her skin...

title: Hunter Biden trial on gun charges set for June
summary: In October, the US president's son pleaded not guilty to the gun charges. If convicted, he could in theory face 25 years in prison.

title: UN to launch 'airbridge' to get aid into Haiti
summary: A powerful Haitian gang leader pledged Wednesday to continue the fighting that has plunged the country into chaos.

title: Countries are bouncing back from Covid-19 pandemic but not the poorest ones
summary: A report from the UN Development Progam said Wednesday that after two decades during which rich and poor countries were coming closer, the poorest countries are seeing conditions deteriorating.

title: Ukrainians are growing tired of imposed 'telemarathon'
summary: Since the start of the Russian invasion, 6 channels have been broadcasting the same 24-hour news program.

title: Ukraine: The perils of enemy observation at the Donbas front
summary: Surveillance drone operators are essential for attacking logistics deep behind Russian lines. For this reason, they are a priority target for opposing artillery.

title: In China, ultranationalists attack Zhong Shanshan, the country's richest man, over an iced tea bottle design
summary: Internet users blasted Nongfu Spring's founder for an image on a bottle label that, they claim, looks like a Japanese temple. Attacks that used to be only aimed at foreign companies are becoming increasingly unrestrained.

title: Macron promises to add 'consent' to France's rape law
summary: In a video filmed on March 8, the French president is seen telling a women's rights group he is in favor of adding the notion of consent to France's rape law, which currently does not mention it.

title: Will TikTok be banned in the US? The Senate will decide
summary: The bill, passed by 352 votes to 65 in the House of Representatives, would require ByteDance's subsidiary to be sold to a non-Chinese operator within six months.

title: Sciences Po divided over contradictory versions of pro-Palestinian rally
summary: President Emmanuel Macron weighed in on a protest at the Paris university, saying 'unspeakable' remarks were made toward a student from the Union of Jewish Students in France. Students who were present offered different accounts of what happened.

title: 'Can Joe Biden make a surprise comeback like Harry S. Truman did in 1948?'
summary: Biden's powerful State of the Union address to Congress on March 7 may be the start of his resurgence against Trump to win the next presidential election, explains Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Why Europe's housing crisis is taking hold
summary: From Sweden to Spain, via the Netherlands and Greece, inadequate construction rates and excessive tourism have accentuated the housing shortage, while prices remain high.

title: Israel wants to control what little food enters Gaza
summary: Israel bombed a food distribution center belonging to UNRWA, the UN agency for Palestinians, killing one employee and wounding 22 others.

title: Macron decorates world's richest man Arnault as Beyoncé, Musk look on
summary: The French president honored the founder of the luxury goods giant LVMH with country's highest honor, the Grand Cross of the Legion d'Honneur.

title: Friendly rivals? Top French MEPs face off in European elections after cordial term
summary: From the right-wing Les Républicains to La France Insoumise on the left, the MEPs up for re-election in June 6 have maintained cordial relations throughout their term of office. This atmosphere contrasts with the belligerent climate prevailing in Paris.

title: European elections: Why is the RN putting forward a notoriously pro-Russian MEP?
summary: Thierry Mariani, despite being known for pro-Kremlin positions, will represent the far-right Rassemblement National party during the first debate of the European elections campaign, instead of lead candidate Jordan Bardella.

title: Deschamps recalls Diaby to France squad for March friendlies
summary: Aston Villa winger Moussa Diaby returns to the squad for the first time in a year as France takez on Germany and Chile.

title: China blasts US TikTok vote as buyout plan emerges
summary: The former US Treasury secretary Steven Munchin said he was going to put together an investor group to buy the short-video application, one day after the House of Representatives passed a bill that could see it banned.

title: Italy fines TikTok €10 million for failing to protect minors
summary: Italy's competition authority said TikTok had not fully complied with guidelines it had advertised to reassure consumers the app was a 'safe' space.

title: UK government presents divisive new definition of extremism
summary: The government added on Thursday that this will be used to decide which organizations get public funding. It provoked criticism from civil, political and religious groups.

title: War in Ukraine: Emmanuel Macron's metamorphosis from dove to hawk
summary: Over two years of the conflict, the French president has gone from not wanting to 'humiliate Russia' to suggesting that troops be sent to Ukraine. During this time, he has been confronted by Putin's warlike, all-out logic.

title: US Senate leader Schumer calls for 'new election' in Israel
summary: In a speech, Democrat Chuck Schumer suggested that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu risked making Israel a 'pariah.'

title: Spain passes amnesty law for Catalan separatists
summary: Spanish MPs voted 178 in favor to 172 against on Thursday, with the bill seeking to draw a line under years of efforts to prosecute those involved in the botched 2017 independence bid that triggered Spain's worst political crisis in decades.

title: France unveils plan to rebuild Beirut port
summary: A proposal prepared by engineering firms Artelia and Egis calls for investments of between $50 million and $80 million.

title: France's CNews channel grilled by lawmakers over 'right-wing content'
summary: Vincent Bolloré, the owner of what is widely seen as France's equivalent to Fox News, was questioned by lawmakers on Wednesday at the Assemblée Nationale.

title: Belgian aid worker Olivier Vandecasteele: 'Iran made me a bargaining chip for its shameful haggling'
summary: After 455 days in prison in Tehran, Belgian Olivier Vandecasteele was freed in a prisoner swap. He has since launched Protect Humanitarians, which he hopes will help humanitarian workers under threat.

title: Mbappé  presence at Olympics 'very difficult,' says France coach Deschamps
summary: Didier Deschamps said the Euro 2024 remained the 'priority' for his players.
